message.content:
cs.GT, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.MA, cs.IT

Reasoning: 
1. cs.GT (Game Theory): The paper deals with a dynamic game with transferable utilities and focuses on finding allocation rules that guarantee convergence of the average allocations to the core of the average game. This is a core topic in game theory, and hence, cs.GT is the most likely sub-category.
2. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper also discusses Lyapunov stochastic stability and control of the dynamic coalitional game. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.SY sub-category.
3. cs.LG (Learning): The paper mentions approachability theory and attainability theory, which are related to learning in games. Hence, cs.LG is also a likely sub-category.
4. cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems): The paper deals with a game involving multiple agents, and hence, cs.MA is a possible sub-category.
5. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper discusses partial observation on the extra reward, which may involve information theory concepts. Hence, cs.IT is also a possible sub-category.
